alert.note: Alert for Boone; Kanawha; Lincoln (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 5:47PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Kanawha, northeastern Lincoln and north central Boone Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 546 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Alum Creek, or 12 miles south of Nitro, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Jefferson, South Charleston, Dunbar, Alum Creek, Tornado and Sod. This includes the following highways... Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 53 and 57. Route 119 between mile markers 61 and 79. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to travel across flooded roads. Find alternate routes. It takes only a few inches of swiftly flowing water to carry vehicles away. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central West Virginia.
